VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Venture Capital relative to the peak of Stock Market in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Venture Capital is to the {right} of the peak of Stock Market.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Stock Market show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Stock Market shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Venture Capital reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Stock Market} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =19.2?
EVJ.A: At X =19.2,the label with the highest density is {Bonds}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 4? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 19? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Stock Market}'s peak at {-5},{Real Estate}'s peak at {-6},{Venture Capital}'s peak at {-3},{Angel Investments}'s peak at {-6}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Venture Capital or Stock Market?
NC.A: {Venture Capital} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Venture Capital or Commodities?
NC.A: {Commodities} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Stock Market}
